  • Method Details

    • removeMultipleLetters

      public static String removeMultipleLetters(String s)
      Returns a string similar to the given string with all runs of consecutive, repeated characters removed. For example,
      • given "apple", returns "aple"
      • given "banana", returns "banana"
      • given "baaannannnnaa", returns "banana"
      • given an empty string, returns an empty string
      Parameters:
      s - given string
      Returns:
      string created from s by removing runs of the same character

    • findStoppingTime

      public static int findStoppingTime(int n)
      Returns the number of iterations required until n is equal to 1, where each iteration updates n in the following way: 
           if n is even
         divide it in half
     else
         multiply n by three and add 1
      For example, given n == 6, the successive values of n would be 3, 10, 5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1, so the method returns 8. If n is less than 1, the method returns -1.

      (Remark: How do we know this won't be an infinite loop for some values of n? In general, we don't: in fact this is a well-known open problem in mathematics. However, it has been checked for numbers up to 10 billion, which covers the range of possible values of the Java int type.)

      Parameters:
      n - given starting number
      Returns:
      number of iterations required to reach n == 1, or -1 if n is not positive

    • reverseWords

      public static String reverseWords(String s)
      Reverses the order of words in a given string, where a "word" is any set of adjacent characters separated by whitespace. For example,
      • given "banana ", returns "banana"
      • given an empty string, returns an empty string
      • given "Hasta la vista, baby!", the method returns "baby! vista, Hasta la"
      Parameters:
      s - a given string of text
      Returns:
      the given string with the order of words reversed

    • isArithmetic

      public static boolean isArithmetic(String text)
      Given a string of text containing numbers separated by commas, returns true if the numbers form an arithmetic sequence (a sequence in which each value differs from the previous one by a fixed amount). For example,
      • given "2, 4, 6, 8", the method returns true
      • given "-2, 5, 12, 19, 26", returns true
      • given "2, 4, 7", returns false
      • given "1, 2, 23skidoo", returns false
      The method should return true for any string containing two or fewer numbers and false for any invalid string. Note that there may or may not be spaces after each comma.
      Parameters:
      text - a string of text containing numbers separated by commas
      Returns:
      true if each number differs from the previous one by the same amount

    • longestRun

      public static int longestRun(String s)
      Returns the length of the longest consecutive run of the same character in a string s. For example, for "baaanaannnnaa", the method returns 4, since there is a run of four 'n' characters. For "banana" the method returns 1.
      Parameters:
      s - a given string
      Returns:
      length of longest consecutive run of a character

    • interleaveWithRuns

      public static String interleaveWithRuns(String s, String t)
      Returns a string obtained by alternating characters from two given strings, starting with the first character of the first string. If one of the strings is longer, the extra characters are appended to the end of the result. Runs of the same character are kept together. For example
      • given "abc" and "xyz", returns "axbycz"
      • given "abcde" and "xyz", returns "axbyczde"
      • given "abcde" and "abc", returns "aabbccde"
      • given "abbcde" and "xxxyzzzz", returns "axxxbbyczzzzde"
      Parameters:
      s - first given string
      t - second given string
      Returns:
      string obtained by alternating characters from s and t
